Assets.Functionality: Facilitates communication between the FPU and the core.
Assets.Justification: If the CCX interface is susceptible to unauthorized access, there could be a risk of leaking computation results.

Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1318: The CCX interface may lack support for security features like access control, risking unauthorized access to floating-point computation results.
Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1262: Improper access control on the CCX interface could allow unauthorized access to memory-mapped registers, leading to potential data leaks.
Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1429: The CCX interface might silently discard unauthorized access attempts without feedback, allowing attackers to bypass security monitoring.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-180: CAPEC-180 can exploit CWE-1318 by intercepting and manipulating the CCX interface communications, leading to unauthorized access and potential leakage of sensitive floating-point computation results, thereby compromising confidentiality.
Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-150: CAPEC-150 could exploit CWE-1318 by inducing faults in the CCX interface's arbitration logic, potentially allowing unauthorized access to FPU data streams and resulting in information disclosure, thus breaching confidentiality.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-680: CAPEC-680 can exploit CWE-1262 by manipulating the arbitration logic of the CCX interface to prioritize unauthorized access, potentially leading to the leakage of sensitive floating-point computation results, thus compromising confidentiality.
Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-150: CAPEC-150 can exploit CWE-1262 by injecting malformed data packets into the CCX interface, causing misconfiguration and unauthorized access to floating-point computation results, thereby breaching confidentiality.

CAPEC-150 can exploit CWE-1429 by intercepting and manipulating the CCX interface communications, leading to unauthorized access and potential leakage of sensitive floating-point computation results, thereby compromising confidentiality.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-150: [CWE-1318] CAPEC-150 could exploit CWE-1318 by inducing faults in the CCX interface's arbitration logic, potentially allowing unauthorized access to FPU data streams and resulting in information disclosure, thus breaching confidentiality. [CWE-1262] CAPEC-150 can exploit CWE-1262 by injecting malformed data packets into the CCX interface, causing misconfiguration and unauthorized access to floating-point computation results, thereby breaching confidentiality. [CWE-1429] CAPEC-150 can exploit CWE-1429 by intercepting and manipulating the CCX interface communications, leading to unauthorized access and potential leakage of sensitive floating-point computation results, thereby compromising confidentiality.
Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-680: [CWE-1262] CAPEC-680 can exploit CWE-1262 by manipulating the arbitration logic of the CCX interface to prioritize unauthorized access, potentially leading to the leakage of sensitive floating-point computation results, thus compromising confidentiality.

Assets.Functionality: Facilitates communication between the FPU and the core.
Assets.Justification: Misconfiguration or excessive arbitration delays on the CCX interface could potentially lead to reduced availability of the FPU, impacting system performance.

Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1318: The CCX interface may lack proper configuration to support security features, leading to potential denial of service if misconfigured, affecting FPU availability.
Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1429: The CCX interface could silently discard operations without feedback, leading to undetected failures or delays, impacting FPU availability.
Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1317: Improper access control in the CCX interface could allow unauthorized transactions, affecting the availability and performance of the FPU.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-180: CAPEC-180 can exploit CWE-1318 by manipulating the arbitration logic of the CCX interface to induce excessive delays, thereby reducing the availability of the FPU and impacting system performance.
Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-150: CAPEC-150 can exploit CWE-1318 by causing misconfigurations in the CCX interface settings, leading to improper prioritization and reduced availability of the FPU, which affects the overall system throughput.
CAPEC-150 can exploit CWE-1429 by manipulating the arbitration logic of the CCX interface, causing excessive delays that reduce the availability of the FPU, thereby impacting system performance.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-122: CAPEC-122 can exploit CWE-1317 by manipulating the arbitration logic of the CCX interface to create excessive delays, thereby reducing the availability of the FPU and impacting system performance.
Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-150: CAPEC-150 could exploit CWE-1317 by introducing misconfigurations in the CCX interface settings, leading to improper prioritization and reduced availability of the FPU, affecting its performance.
